item.title: Report I-2024070155
item.description:
Report I-2024070155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: Shorter
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SLAY TRANSPORTATION CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the folllowing occurred. During an inspection of the tanker, the driver discovered a drip from loose valve. Approximately one gallon of free product was released onto asphalt. Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Miller Environmental Group deployed absorbent material to recover the free liquid. The loose valve was tightened in order to terminal the release.

item.title: Report E-2024080439
item.description:
Report E-2024080439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11, 2024, at 0239 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Bessemer, Alabama regarding the release of ZEP Formula 940-E (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., (Sodium Metasilicate), 8, II). Terminal personnel reported that a total of 2 cups were release during transit from 4 crushed 1-gallon plastic bottles due to improper loading and impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release with absorbents, then containerized all waste in (1) 55-gallon DF that was staged onsite pending disposal.
